fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page
# Insert 3x3 table
# Point cursor {{I}} to the middle row/column of the table
!middle.png|thumbnail!
# Go to _+ Insert_ menu > _Other macros_
!insert_macro.png|thumbnail!
# Search for _JIRA_ and click it
!search.png|thumbnail!
# Search for JIRA issue and click _Insert_
!issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected result
JIRA issue will be inserted into the middle row/column of the table.
!expected.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual result
JIRA issue is inserted into the row before the table.
!actual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Instead of inserting JIRA issue macro using _+ Insert_ menu > _Other macros_, please use _+ Insert_ menu > _JIRA Issue_ to insert JIRA issue at your desired section.
!jira_issue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro cannot be inserted into the correct cell IE10

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue: # Enable all HTML module for the HTML plugin. # Create a new page with the following code in the HTML macro: {code}

css script

{code} # In the HTML macro preview, it shows up correctly: !macro_preview.png! # In the page preview, it fails to apply the background colour to the text: !page_preview.png! # After saving the page, the background colour is not rendered at all. !page_saved.png!
fields.summary: HTML macro failed to render the CSS setting correctly
Add the ability to comment a task (especially when setting it "completed")

fields.description:
Some fields like {{creator}} and {{lastmodifier}} are lost after an xml import. (They are correctly set in the xml file) which results in the below miss behaviours:
* Users lost their personal spaces post xml import, and are unable to create a new one.
* Confluence questions sections are broken and no longer work post xml import.

h4. Work around:

Follow below guide for the first miss behaviour:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Spining+wheel+loads+forever+while+creating+Personal+Space

Follow this second guide for sections broken on Confluence questions:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Some+questions+or+answers+are+missing+after+a+XML+import
fields.summary: Creator and Lastmodifier lost after XML import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34683].
  {panel}

recently updated dashboard does not update the name of the user after it is being changed.

Steps to reproduce
# Login to Confluence
# Go to a page
# Click edit and choose Insert > Other Macros
# Choose Recently Updated Dashboard
# Take note the name of the user that appear in the Recently Updated Dashboard.
# Go to Confluence Administration >> User management
# Search for the user that appears in the Recently Updated Dashboard
# Click on the user and Edit Details
# Change the "Full Name" of the user and click Submit
# Go back to the Recently Updated Dashboard page and hover over the user like the screenshot below
!recentlyupdatedDashboardbug.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: recently updated dashboard does not update user's name

fields.description:
When I upload an image or use the feature extra -> copy, the images will always turn to unkown attachment. I do have the problem creating this, but my colleagues either see these pictures or they don't, even if they are not visible for me. 
This mainly affects pages I created, but not on every single page. 

We use Conf. V. 5.1.4 and this appears both on firefox and chrome using the newest version. 

Thanks for your help,
Dominik
fields.summary: Image turns to unknown attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34681].
  {panel}

I made a confluence page on the 20th august 2014. 
Today ( 25 august ) I start editing the page with content.

Current: On the top under the title it says: Created and last modified by Kristof Van Kriekingen 8 minutes ago

The created shouldn't be there at all or it should indicate it was been created at 20/08/2014 - 10:48 AM

Expected: 
Created on 20/08/2014 - 10:48 AM and last modified by Kristof Van Kriekingen 8 minutes ago.
fields.summary: Creation date and last modified date are the same in the interface
Make quick reload plugin available in Confluence Data Center
Make workbox notifications available in Confluence Data Center
Upgrade Confluence OnDemand to Gliffy 6.2.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34676].
  {panel}

This is a follow-up issue because CONF-28275 was resolved with keeping the rounded logo approach.
----

1. Provide an option to have either rectangular (like in Confluence version before Confluence 5) nex to the rounded Space Logos - reasons? Please read all the related comments in CONF-28275.
\\
\\
2. _*Don't automatically adjust and resize existing logos*_ if a customer updates to a version of Confluence which introduces the rounded Space Logo design.
\\
\\
fields.summary: Provide a way to keep rectangular Space Logos in Confluence 5 especially in case of migration from Confluence 4

fields.description:
If a user has implemented custom CSS and sets overflow: hidden, if they edit the page in IE 11 and click the element that is styled they will have a box that can be resized. If the user resizes the box, it will cut off part of the element. Once saved, this resized element will appear cut off in all browsers.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Navigate to Confluence in IE11
# Add h2 { overflow: hidden; } to either the Global Stylesheet or a Space Stylesheet.
# Create a page and add an h2 object, you should immediately see a resizable box
# Enter text into the box, resize to cutoff part of the text
# Save and view in any browser

h3. Expected behavior
There should not be a resizable box showing, which is the behavior when editing a page with this CSS in any other browser

h3. Actual behavior
There is a resizable box that if resized will cut off content

h3. Related Notes
* The box does not show in the editor in any other browser
* Removing the overflow: hidden property will resolve the issue.
fields.summary: When editing a page in IE11 with an element styled with overflow: hidden there is a resizable box
Automatically Move Completed Task from "Incomplete Task" list

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When a blog entry links to another page in Confluence, and is seen in the Blog Post Macro on a page, it does not display the link or provide link functionality.  This is only true when using the 'Content Type to Display' of 'excerpts.'  When using 'entire,' the link displays correctly.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

   * Create a blog post in Confluence that includes a link to a page within Confluence
   * Create a new page that uses the ‘Blog Post’ Macro
      * When completing the setup of the macro, set the ‘Content Type to Display’ to ‘excerpts’ and save
      * Save the page
   * The link in the blogs on the page appear as regular text and do not link.
   * If you edit the blog post macro and select ‘entire,’ the links will show correctly

h2. Expected Result
We would expect to see the link having link functions (link to the article, Blue font, and underlined when hovered over) when using the ‘excerpt’ option.

h2. Actual Result
The link appears as regular text and does not actually link to anything.

h2. Environment
I am using Mac OS, Firefox and Chrome and Confluence version 5.5.4.  Customer is using Confluence 5.5.4, IE 11.0.960017207 and FireFox 31.0, running Win7 Ultimate SP1
fields.summary: Blog Post Macro Does not Display Links When Using 'Excerpts' Content Type

fields.description:
Viewing a user profile in confluence 5.3.4 (a different users profile) shows a link to 'Personal Space'.

h3. expected behavior:
One would think that viewing a profile of another user and seeing a link saying 'personal space' would take you to the personal space of the user profile you are viewing. 

h3. actual behavior
If viewing another user's profile and click the personal space link, you are directed to your own personal space. 

<base_url>/users/viewuserprofile.action?username=<username>
fields.summary: Clicking personal space link from a user profile takes you to your personal space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34654].
  {panel}

Exactly the same request as CONF-25638, but with different reasons.

I find renaming images really confusing and unpleasent user experience, mainly from this scenario:
# When editing a page with lots of clipboard pasted images.
# I pasted lots of images.
# Now i want to rename the pictures properly for easy referencing.
# Went to the attachments of the page, not so good looking.
# Started to rename files, and I need to tab-shift back and forth with different tabs just to preview the images so i don't rename them wrongly.

This is absolutely madness if i need to do this even once a day or a few times a week.

Please, include the thumbnail of the image some where in the property of the attachment if it is a image type.
fields.summary: Display image thumbnail (preview) in Image Properties page for easy renaming user experience

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34653].
  {panel}

When you are on a confluence page. ( Read only mode )
You scroll down until the end of the page and then you would have to scroll all the way up again to press edit. This can be avoided by using the shortcut key: ' E ' .

Current:
When you are at the bottom of the page and press 'E' to edit, you fly all the way up to the top of the page again.

Expected: 
When I press ' E ' at the bottom of the page, I want to stay at the same level / spot on the page in edit mode.


Kind regards
Kristof
fields.summary: Pressing 'E' to edit a page, stay on the same page lvl

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34650].
  {panel}

I tested 5.2.3 and was able to reproduce the issue, but it could potentially have existed much earlier.

It appears that both of the following are required to reproduce the issue:
* Blog post must contain an image in its content (or at least some kind of resource - testing with a simple paragraph didn't reproduce the issue)
* # symbol in blog post title needs to be followed by another character - a title such as {{Testing #2}} will reproduce the problem

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a blog post with the title {{Testing #2}}
# Insert an image into the page contents
# Save the page
# While viewing the page, click on {{Tools > Page Information}}

Observe the following stacktrace:
{noformat}

fields.description:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with name 'abc' 
# Create other page with name 'page to be moved'
# Insert a link to 'page to be moved' on 'abc'
# Delete page 'abc'
# Create a page with name 'abc' again 
#- This operation is successful
# Insert a link to 'page to be moved' on 'abc' (optional)
# Move 'page to be moved' to somewhere else
#- This operation fails. The below appears in the atlassian-confluence.log

{code}
2014-08-12 10:06:51,870 ERROR [http-bio-8391-exec-507] [atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageMoveCompletedEvent[source=page: "Page that is failed to be moved" v.14 (11239782)]] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.confluence.links.RelatedContentRefactoringListener.handleEvent(com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.page.PageMoveCompletedEvent), listener=com.atlassian.confluence.links.RelatedContentRefactoringListener@5f33c0b7}]

h3. Workaround

h4. Option 1:
# Change title of the page to be moved.
(i) i.e. "Release Notes" to "Release Notes v1.0".
# Move page to desired location.
(i) The new title can be changed back to the original after completion.

h4. Option 2:
# Check the error in the logs to find the space that contains the deleted page (this may not be the same space as the page you are moving).
# Purge the trash in that space ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Purging+Deleted+Pages]). 
(!) When the trash is purged, all attachments on purged pages are permanently removed as well.

h4. Option 3:
# Clone the page via _Tools_ > _Copy_ and save the page.
(i) The title of the page will be "Copy of <page_title>".
# Move cloned page to desired location.
(i) You may rename the title page to the original after moving operation is successful by removing the "Copy of" words from the title. 
# Delete the old page (can't be moved) to remove redundancies.
fields.summary: Page move fails because of a deleted page

fields.description:
The JIRA Icons plugin uses the linked JIRA address to get Issue Type Icons from JIRA. But if JIRA is running behind a Apache ssl server and has a local address(127.0.0.1) it uses this ip to try to get the icons for the client.
I attached a screenshot to show what I mean. Maybe the plugin should cache the icons and embed them via the own server, but the icons work when creating a link so maybe there is another workaround for that.
fields.summary: JIRA Macros Plugin does not link Icons correctly

fields.description:
Moving a page with assigned tasks on the page, causes the actual owner of the task to change for *some* of the tasks.

To reproduce:

* Create two blank pages (named One and Two).
* Create another page as a child page under page One.
* Add two tasks by the creator of the page for themself, and two tasks for an additional user.
* Log out and log in as the second user you assigned two tasks to.
* Add two additional tasks to this page for this user, and two for the original user.
* Now have this second user move the page with Tasks to be a child page of page Two.
* Now browse to this user's Tasks.  At least one of their tasks will be missing.
* Log in as the original user and check the Tasks.  They will have one additional.

I think there are probably many variations of this.  I can't quite determine the magic formula.
fields.summary: Moving a page with tasks causes task owner to change

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a page with a 2 column layout 2. In the left column, add a heading 3. Save the page - observe that the heading is in the left column 4. Edit the page, select all the content in the left column, cut and paste into the right column 5. Save the page and observe that the content has not moved Workaround is to ensure that the left column has some content (e.g. a space). It turns out that empty page layout cells are excluded when the page is converted to storage format. Storage format for two-column layout with an empty cell (storage format is the same regardless of which column has content): {code}

Heading

Some content.

 

 {code} Storage format when both columns contain content: {code}

Heading

Some content.

 

 

 {code}
fields.summary: Empty page layout cells are excluded from storage format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34624].
  {panel}

My workflow follows:

1. Track time in external application.
2. Apply time in JIRA at period end.
3. Browse to Timesheet page.
4. Click "Log Work" to open Log Work screen (see attached).
5. Set the date to the first day of the time period.
6. Enter the date (by clicking and selecting or typing; both are slow).
7. Enter the hours.
8. Repeat from step 6.

I would like to see a slightly more advanced Log Work screen.

1. Ability to click a next/previous day to adjust the date forward/backward (the UI should be responsive to fast clicks).
2. Ability to automatically pre-populate the date field with the date that succeeds the last day that has a log entry (e.g., if the last timesheet entry was made on Aug 12, then the Log Work should display Aug 13 as the date).
fields.summary: Log Work: Next/Prev and Pre-populate Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34619].
  {panel}

In https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions#PageRestrictions-Requestandgrantaccesstoviewarestrictedpage, at section 'Who can grant access?', the paragraph:
{quote}
Confluence will send an email to the a user who can grant permissions - this will be either the last user (with appropriate permissions) to edit the page, the page creator or a space admin. Confluence will try each of these roles in turn, emailing the first user that has appropriate permissions.
{quote}
... doesn't elaborate the sequence of 'request access' email goes to.

It should elaborate that the order would be:
# the last person to edit the page
# *all* non-admin people that can set permissions on the page (given that admin always can)
# the page creator
# *all* the space administrators

Changing this would solve confusion and provide clarity when reading the documentation.
fields.summary: More Detailed Explanation In 'Who can grant access?' Section
Workbox notification as a page macro

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce  - Use Internet Explorer 11 (With Google Chrome, this works)
My config: Windows 7 - Confluence 5.5.4 - IE11

1) Create a new page - give it a title (Panel bug example)
2) Type some text in the page: This is my text (+enter)
3) Via the GUI, Insert a new macro: Panel, set Panel Title: "Cannot put content in it" and click Insert
4) You are back in the editor now, use your mouse to select the text "This is my text" and cut it (you want to put the text in the panel)
5) It's not possible to put the cursor in the Panel (and you can't paste the text in the Panel)...

Remark: after saving the page and re-opening the page, you can put your cursor in the Panel, but this should work on a new page as well with IE11.
fields.summary: Cannot put cursor in new panel after leaving the panel - IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34614].
  {panel}

Hello!

I have downloaded Confluence for Server use and installed it on a Virtual machine. First everything was perfect. Then problem started when i was trying to log in after logging out. Every-time i try to log in I get the message to re-enter my username and password with the Captcha, and when i do it does not log in and re-asks for my username and password. I clicked on "Forgot your password?" I ended up with the following message:
 "Sorry, you can't retrieve your password as no email service has been configured for Confluence. Please contact your administrators for assistance."
Logging in to confluence works fine outside the virtual machine, the problem is when i tried to access in the machine.

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create Application link with following details:
## Application URL: http://jiratest.domain.internal:8083

# Click on the JIRA Macros.

Display URL should return in the browser.

Application URL will return in the browser instead of display URL. However, JIRA Macros are working fine.

fields.description:
[~mfernandezbadii] posted this on CONF-33207:

{quote}
I found that restricted child pages (not the whole space), will still show on the Popular Tab.

*Example:*
User can browse a Space.
Restricted page is created and user can't browse it or see it in the Popular Tab.
Child page is created: User can't browse it because of permissions inherited from parent, but it is still listed on the Popular Tab of that user.
Expected: Child page shouldn't appear on Popular Tab since user doesn't have permissions to browse it.

*Workaround:*
Move restricted content to another restricted Space.
{quote}

It looks like the work we did to fix permission handling in CONF-33446 did not cover child content.
fields.summary: Child pages permissions are not respected in Popular Tab

fields.description:
h3. Use Case
Including PDF/PPT in a CONF-page within a body macro (e.g. info-box or panel).

h3. Bug
Slide navigation elements are not displayed correctly when inserting a PDF/PPT Macro within another body-macro like the Info-Box or Panel.

h3. Environment (tested)
* Browser: IE11, Chrome 36, FF 31
* Confluence 5.4.2 and 5.5.2

h3. Screenshots
h4. PDF within body macro
!PDF_Include_in_body_macro_bug.PNG|width=450!
h4. PPT within body macro
!PPT_Include_in_body_macro_bug.PNG|width=450!

h3. Further information
As you can see on the 1st screenshot 2nd example the PDF included in a panel-macro seemes to be working properly. Maybe this information helps you identifying the cause of that bug.
fields.summary: PPT and PDF Macros within other body macros dont show slide navigation properly

fields.description:
Affected plugins are those that use wiki markup to enter embeddable javascript inside macros. This is known to affect:
# Run macro
# Some bespoke macros created by customers

Because of the potential for this to disrupt functionality of various important plugins, we have removed Confluence 5.5.4 from the download page.

If you are currently running Confluence 5.5.4 and your plugins are all working as expected, you *are not affected* by this bug and can continue to use Confluence 5.5.4.

If you are on Confluence 5.5.4 and are experiencing issues with your plugins, please [contact Support|https://support.atlassian.com].

fields.description:
While updating Confluence, it refused to start because an expired license key was entered. The message in the log was: {code} 2014-08-14 22:22:18,282 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized 1 errors were encountered during upgrade: 2014-08-14 22:22:18,283 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeLauncherServletContextListener] contextInitialized 1:

Cannot proceed with upgrade. Your current license does not entitle you to upgrade to this version of Confluence because it is now outside of its support period. If you wish to renew it, please access My Atlassian as the license contact and purchase a license renewal for Confluence. If you have a new license, please enter it on this page and restart.

Alternatively, you can continue using Confluence by rolling back to a previous version. To do this you must perform a clean installation of Confluence of the version that needs to be restored then restore the confluence home directory to its pre-upgrade state. No database restorations need to be made.

{code} The problem is the Server ID isn't shown anywhere in the log or on _fixlicense.action_ page. However, Server ID is required when generating a new license key. Correct behavior: Server ID should be displayed either in the log or on the _fixlicense_ page.
fields.summary: Server ID not shown in error message while updating without a valid license

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34591].
  {panel}

Unable to display a newly created JIRA Issue Macro with Error {{*<JIRAISSUE>* has been created, but there is a problem in adding it to the page. You can manually add it later using JIRA macro.}} by highlighting a Hyperlink text

*Steps to replicate*
# Ensure Confluence is connected to JIRA and at least one project is created in JIRA
# Create a new Confluence page
# Type a sample word (e.g.: Type "Hyperlink")
# Highlight the word in Step 3
# Click on 'Link' at the formatting panel
# Select 'Web Link', set the address to any site (e.g: set it to http://www.google.com), and click save
# Save the page
# Highlight the word created in Step 3 (highlight the whole word)
# Click JIRA Icon and attempt to create a JIRA issue
# This warning appears and the JIRA issue macro is not included in the page:
!^JIRAIssueMacroNotDisplayed.JPG!
fields.summary: Unable to Display JIRA Issue Macro By Highlighting a Hyperlink Text

fields.description:
Unable to display a newly created JIRA Issue Macro with Error {{** has been created, but there is a problem in adding it to the page. You can manually add it later using JIRA macro.}} by highlighting text with the following condition: - The highlighted text located below a Heading - TOC Macro exists above the Heading - The Heading consists of the same word with the highlighted text *Steps to replicate* # Ensure Confluence is connected to JIRA and at least one project is created in JIRA # Create a new Confluence page # Insert a TOC macro # Press enter to go to a new line # Type a sample word (e.g.: type 'Test') # Press enter to go to a new line # Type again the sample word in Step 5 # Make the sample word in Step 5 as Heading 3 # Here's a sample storage format before replicating the issue: {code}

Test

Test

{code} # Save the page # Highlight the sample word in Step 7 (highlight the whole word without any trailing or leading white space) # Click JIRA Icon and attempt to create a JIRA issue # This warning appears and the JIRA issue macro is not included in the page: !^JIRAIssueMacroNotDisplayed.JPG! *Workaround* - Rename the Heading to be a different word and change it back after successfully creating JIRA issue macro _OR_ - Remove the TOC macro and insert it back after successfully creating JIRA issue macro
fields.summary: Unable to Display JIRA Issue Macro By Highlighting Text With The Same Name as Heading and TOC Above It

fields.description:
Hi, 

How are you? 

This has probably been raised but I thought I would submit a ticket. I am using Live Template by service rocket for a Project Doc that is used by up to 20 Teams. 80% of the content of the doc is form based but each individual needs to link to Jira. The only workaround to bypass the live template was to embed the Jira Plugin macro in a text data (Service Rocket) macros (Set to RichText) so that it will pop up when the users go to Edit Contents. This works quite well but it is a little buggy. It takes a couple of clicks on edit to open the macro settings and then there is no Done/Save button. We workaround it by using CTRL+ALT+RETURN keyboard shortcut. 

I understand that this is not strictly by design and it may be the Text Data Macro causing it which is service rockets dealio but I just thought you might like to know. 

have a good day, 

Conor
fields.summary: No Done/Save Button in Jira Macro when embedded in the Text Data Macro

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Establish an Application Link between JIRA and Confluence using Basic Authentication with both instance administration credentials.
# Create a project with several issue in JIRA.
# Create a Space and a Page in Confluence.
# Insert a list of JIRA Issue in the Confluence Page (e.g. project = TEST)
# Insert Other Macros and select JIRA Chart then use the same JQL/search.
# Save the page and set Confluence/Space/Page to be able to be accessed by Anonymous user.
# Log out and access the page.

*Expected Result:*
While using JIRA Admin user to authenticate, the anonymous user will see the Issues and JIRA Chart.

*Actual Result:*
The issue will not appear and there is a warning for the JIRA Chart.

*Notes:*
* Obviously, if the JIRA project can be accessed by anonymous user the information will be shown.
* If there is a single issue mentioned in the page, the anon user will able to click and see it on JIRA View.
* For those who login to Confluence will be able to see the issues.

Anon User:
!anonconf.png|thumbnail!

Logged User:
!loggedconf.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Anonymous User unable to view JIRA Information while using Basic Authentication.

fields.description:
h3. Original Description 
When installing confluence I set the listen port to 8096 because jira was already set up on 8090.  When I closed the installer my browser poped up with a page not found message.  

I later attempted to open jira and the confluence startup page was visible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.6.0 and configure a custom port
# Upgrade to 5.6.1 using the installer, and confirm that the port is preserved
# Upgrade to 5.6.5 and confirm that the port is now back to the default of 8090 in the server.xml

h3. Fix
Edit the server.xml and correct the port number. You can find the old port number in the server.xml in the installation directory backup created by the installer.
fields.summary: Confluence Windows and Linux Installer - Ignored custom listen port setting

fields.description:
h2. Summary
A user is attempting to add the following url as a Space Shortcut:
{code}
https://support.xxxxxxxxx.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=23200&issuetype=6&priority=2&summary=Enter+Job+Nbr+and+Brief+Error+Description+(Ex+XJ121200-Deadlock+Error)&environment=QA+Pilot+or+Production&description=Abend+Information:+%0D+Tivoli+Job+Stream:+%0D+Abend+Type:+%0D+Abend+Action:+%0D+Abend+Date:+%0D+Who+Resolved+Issue:+%0D+Error:+%0D+Abend+Description:+%0D+Abend+Resolution:+%0D+Follow-up+Needed:+%0D+Abend+Status:
{code}
(need to scroll right to see the total url)

After adding the url and clicking the insert button, the window disappears but the link is not posted. No error message or warning appears.  I am submitting this as a bug since if this is expected behavior, there is no warning or error when the expected outcome is not reached. 

h2. Steps to Reproduce


   * Log in to Confluence
   * Navigate to a Space by selecting ‘Spaces’ along the top bar
   * On the bottom left-hand corner, select ‘Space Tools’ and ‘Configure Sidebar’
   * Under the section labeled ‘Space Shortcuts,’ select ‘add link’
   * In the ‘Insert Link’ window, select ‘Web Link’ from the left hand menu
   * Paste the attached URL in the Address field and select the ‘Insert’ button
   * The link will not appear on the left hand side under ‘Space Shortcuts’


To see the expected behavior


   * Paste the following URL (it is the max 255 characters.  Adding any other character to it will cause it to not show){code}https://support.xxxxxxxxx.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=23200&issuetype=6&priority=2&summary=Enter+Job+Nbr+and+Brief+Error+Description+(Ex+XJ121200-Deadlock+Error)&environment=QA+Pilot+or+Production&description=Abend+Information:+%0D+Tivoli+{code}

h2. Expected Result
We would expect to see the shortcut url on the left hand side of the Space under the ‘Space Shortcuts’ section.  

h2. Actual Result
If the length of the shortcut exceeds 255 characters, the window closes after selecting ‘Insert,’ but nothing appears on the left hand menu under ‘Space Shortcuts.’

h2. Environment
I am using Mac OS, Firefox and Chrome and Confluence version 5.5.3.  I have tried multiple versions and get the same result.
fields.summary: No error message when adding a Space Shortcut with link longer than 255 characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34579].
  {panel}

In some cases, Confluence users sometimes watched content unintentionally and they might not know how to unwatched the page. When this occurred, Confluence administrators will need to identify the page, access the space and disable the user subscription.

Confluence could help its admin greatly if notification management is centralised in Confluence administrators menu. It could help administrator in the following ways:

* Confluence administrators would be able to control every users notification in one menu
** Find the user, when the user selected, the menu will listed all the subscription of the selected user
* This central notification management menu will allow Confluence administrators to disable users subscription to any contents or enabling it
* When Confluence administrators disable users subscription it will trigger an approval notification to the users if the user agrees to it, the subscription will be remove
** If this option is un-tick, the subscription will be disabled without approval. This is necessary if the content is a sensitive content
fields.summary: Provide Centralised Notification Management Menu for Confluence Administrators
